docs.lead_paragraph: A new law in New York requires doctors and hospitals to tell women facing surgery about reconstruction and insurance coverage.

docs.lead_paragraph: The average Medicare drug benefit plan will cost $30 a month next year, a $1-a-month increase from this year's average premium, federal officials said Wednesday afternoon.

headline.main: Medicare Drug Plans Rise $1 a Month

docs.abstract: Low prices and more benefits, Medicare administrators say.
docs.snippet: Low prices and more benefits, Medicare administrators say.

docs.lead_paragraph: In his Political Times column published on Wednesday, Matt Bai offers one theory behind President Obama's fading popularity, which has divided and somewhat puzzled Democrats in Washington. He answered reader questions on what he calls the "legislative box" strategy and other top Washington issues this week.

headline.main: Obama's Struggles: Answers From Matt Bai, Part I

docs.abstract: The Political Times columnist is answering questions from readers this week.
docs.snippet: The Political Times columnist is answering questions from readers this week.

docs.lead_paragraph: Note: Stacy Schiff is the author of "A Great Improvisation: Franklin, France and the Birth of America'' and the forthcoming "Cleopatra: A Life.''
docs.abstract: Gail Collins and writer Stacy Schiff on women and politics and why "feminist" is a dirty word.
docs.snippet: Gail Collins and writer Stacy Schiff on women and politics and why "feminist" is a dirty word.

byline.original: By GAIL COLLINS and STACY SCHIFF

docs.lead_paragraph: COLUMBUS, Ohio - President Obama talked up his economic policies in about as intimate a setting as the White House could manage - an Ohio family's backyard, where he chatted  with neighbors and residents in an effort to convince struggling Americans that a sustained recovery, prodded by his stimulus spending, was on the way.

headline.main: Obama Talks Up Recovery in an Ohio Backyard

docs.abstract: On the last day of his three-day campaign swing, President Obama tells an Ohio family that economic recovery is on the way.
docs.snippet: On the last day of his three-day campaign swing, President Obama tells an Ohio family that economic recovery is on the way.

docs.lead_paragraph: Readers respond to an articles about how scientist are developing tests to identify biological markers for Alzheimer’s.
docs.snippet: Readers respond to an articles about how scientist are developing tests to identify biological markers for Alzheimer’s.

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Executives at the American Federation for Aging Research were encouraged by your Aug. 11 editorial ''Early Detection of Alzheimer's,'' describing how scientists are making strides in developing testing that can identify certain biological markers that can predict Alzheimer's.

docs.lead_paragraph: In June the government cut into its benefits system, the world’s most generous, by limiting unemployment payments to two years instead of four.
